intro: Lysionotus metuoensis subsp. arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is perennial and thrives in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology.
